basics.name: William Chen
basics.summary: Duke University B.A. in Mathematics & Computer Science (’26); incoming M.S. in Computer Science (’26–’27).

work.name: Duke University
work.summary: Advised by Prof. Pan Xu; algorithms with provable guarantees for reinforcement learning; preprint in preparation for ICLR.
highlights: Established an algorithm achieving the information-theoretic lower bound on regret complexity.
Proved regret of Õ(d·sqrt(H^3·K)), improving prior Õ(sqrt(d^3·H^4·K))).

work.name: University of North Carolina
work.summary: Advised by Profs. Mo Liu and Weitong Zhang on tractable, provable linear programs for reinforcement learning.
highlights: In preparation for submission to Operations Research.
Derived guarantees for when online algorithms achieve fast learning rate O(1/n).

work.name: Microsoft
work.summary: Secured a Semifinalist position (Top 2% out of 984 teams), allowing us to work under Microsoft mentorship; worked under Alfredo Deza to iterate an AI-driven, full‑stack storybook mobile application and lead system architecture and deployment.
highlights: Architected and implemented end-to-end system: React Native frontend, Node.js/Express API layer, Dockerized services, and MongoDB Atlas document store.
Integrated Azure OpenAI and Azure Cognitive Services (Text-to-Speech) for generative narration and audio synthesis; implemented prompt engineering and server-side response validation.
Designed low-latency media pipeline with on-device preprocessing, server-side inference orchestration, Azure Blob Storage for assets, and secure SAS token delivery for client downloads.
Implemented streaming audio delivery and synchronization using WebSocket endpoints and chunked TTS streaming to minimize perceived latency on mobile clients.
Containerized CI/CD and deployment workflows using Docker and Azure Container Instances/App Service.

work.name: Duke University
work.summary: Led weekly recitations, held office hours, and graded assignments.
highlights: MATH 230: Probability (Spring 2024)
CS 330: Advanced Algorithms (Spring 2025, Fall 2025)

work.name: Duke University
work.summary: Analyzed convergence of stochastic algorithms via dynamical stability; modeled RMSprop and Adagrad with SDEs.
highlights: Presented at Duke's Annual Undergraduate Research Session (poster).
Duke Undergraduate Research Journal (preprint).

work.name: VR Business Brokers
work.summary: Built valuation models and data infrastructure to support business acquisitions.
highlights: Engineered an ensemble of regularized linear models and gradient boosted trees to generate business valuations.
Deployed model used in over 15 acquisitions, predicting valuations within 90% confidence interval.
Developed and maintained a NoSQL schema in MongoDB to automate Confidential Business Reviews.

work.name: Chen's Kitchen
highlights: Cooking, cleaning, customer service.

projects.name: Stable GANs
projects.summary: Implemented and benchmarked GAN, WGAN, and WGAN-GP to analyze training stability on a large-scale anime face dataset.
highlights: Presented at Duke's AI/ML Workshop (Poster Session Report).

projects.name: Aesop AI
projects.summary: Interactive mobile application that generates visual storybooks with AI-powered voice narration.
highlights: First Place at Duke University's annual hackathon; Semifinalist at Microsoft's Imagine Cup.
Links: Devpost | Microsoft Blog

projects.name: RateMyPath
projects.summary: Web application integrating DukeHub API and scraped RateMyProfessor data to build a database of Duke courses with official student feedback.
